alert.note: Alert for Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 11:49PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff from previous rains continues. * WHERE...Vega Baja. * WHEN...Until 200 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to run high due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 PM AST, USGS River Sensors indicated that Rio Cibuco continues above flood stage, at 15.01 feet from the most recent reports. Emergency managers also indicated flood waters affecting road PR-160 near Sector El Cuerno, and impassable for small vehicles. Flooding is ongoing and will continue for the next few hours in the warned area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
